description:
About rhode: rhode is a line of curated skincare essentials. Formulated for a variety of skin types and needs with high performance ingredients, it's a daily routine that nourishes your skin barrier over time.

rhode is seeking a strategic Demand Planning Manager to join our team in Los Angeles, CA. This manager will be tasked with creating a SKU forecast for our Operations team through statistical analysis, working cross functionally with the Marketing, Product Development, and Finance teams.

Overview & Responsibilities

  • The Demand Planning Manager will create SKU and branch plan level forecasts to achieve financial objectives.
  • Facilitate consensus meetings with our Marketing and Finance teams to ensure forecasting objectives are achieved.
  • Assess risks and opportunities by analyzing historical sales trends and new product launch performance.
  • Quantify new product launch forecasts using historical sales, planned marketing support, and key account merchandising plans.
  • Participate in cross functional project teams to develop best in class forecasting practices.

To be successful:

  • Experience with Operations Planning processes/procedures.
  • Experience with forecasting, demand planning, and supply planning, using an ERP system for a global consumer goods brand.
  • Experience in operating through Integrated Business Planning and S&OP.
  • Strong statistical skills, data visualization, and storytelling skills with experience analyzing, and reviewing trends and data to forecast a holistic story.
  • Get it done attitude, solutions-oriented problem solver.
  • Takes radical accountability and ownership over their duties and responsibilities.
  • Intellectually curious, with a genuine desire and drive to improve the business.
  • Commutable 3 days a week to Beverly Hills with the ability to come in more often as needed.

Qualifications:

Education:

  • BS/BA required.

Work Experience:

  • 3+ years of experience in demand planning for a beauty or skincare brand
  • Advanced skills in Microsoft Excel (pivot tables, lookups, sumif, CSV files)
  • Cross functional collaboration experience

The annual salary for this position is between $115,000 - $130,000, depending on experience and other qualifications of the successful candidate. This role is based out of our headquarters in Los Angeles, CA.
